poem:
**Welcome to the Hive**

In steel and glass, your fingerprint  
becomes a ticket, your iris a key,  
a code embedded deep as blood.  
Each morning, the concrete city hums,  
gates breathing you in, machines  
whispering the secrets you hold  
without a voice, but not without  
a trace, in this hive of human data.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "JP Morgan staff told they must share biometric data to access headquarters JP Morgan Chase has told staff moving into its new headquarters in New York that they must share their biometric data to access the multibillion-dollar building. The investment bank had previously planned for the registering of biometric data by employees at its new Manhattan skyscraper to be voluntary. However, employees of the US’s biggest bank who have started work at its new headquarters". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
